    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • load_data

        public static java.lang.String load_data(java.lang.String inputFile)

      • compute_fd

        public static map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> compute_fd(java.lang.String input)
        loops through the input string and if the hashtable already contains that character in the input, we add 1 to the frequency of said character. else, it is the first time we see that character so we set the frequency to one.
        Parameters:
        input - text file string
        Returns:
        a map with the input characters mapping to their frequencies

      • huffman_tree

        public static BTNode<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> huffman_tree(map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> map)
        Creates a key value node taken from the map in compute_fd. Goes through each key and adds them to a sorted list. Then it loops through the sorted list and starts building the tree, from leaves to the root
        Parameters:
        map - node containing a key and its frequency
        Returns:
        the frequencies of the keys

      • huffman_code

        public static map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> huffman_code(BTNode<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> N)
        calls the method prefix in order to build the key's code
        Parameters:
        N - a node in the huffman tree
        Returns:
        the frequencies of the keys

      • prefix

        public static void prefix(BTNode<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> N,
                          map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map,
                          java.lang.String code)
        first checks if it's a leaf and if it is then just add that key with it's corresponding code to the map. if it's not a leaf then recursively travel through the nodes adding 1s and 0s to it's code depending on the path taken to that key.
        Parameters:
        N - node in the tree
        map - node containing a key and its frequency
        code - a string that contains the key's code in 0s and 1s

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map,
                                      java.lang.String data)
        Converts the input to it's corresponding code
        Parameters:
        map - a map containing the symbol mapping to it's code
        data - the location of the image, relative to the url argument
        Returns:
        a string

      • process_results

        public static void process_results(map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> frequencyDistribution,
                                   map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> encoded,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   java.lang.String result)
        first we loop through the keys on the map containing the keys and their frequencies and creates a new node with the keys and adds that node to the sorted list. loop again through the sorted list and then assign each node to a variable. extract the key, the value from the node and the code from the encoded map.
        Parameters:
        frequencyDistribution - map containing a key with its frequency
        encoded - map containing the key and its code
        data - node containing a key and its frequency
        result - node containing a key and its frequency
